page.title: 05Cranshaws Castle
page.content:
The first record of Cranshaws Castle is in 1350 when the Earls of March owned it. It was passed on to the Swinton family in 1401. After losing possession of it for a few years they regained it in 1412.
In 1702 David Denham bought it. His son James Denham sold the land to James Watson of Saughton in 1739. Then it descended through his mother to Lord Aberdour eldest son of the Earl of Morton. In 1895 it was bought by Andrew Smith of Whitchester and became the property of his grand-nephew in 1931. It was restored by Mr S E A Landale's uncle in 1896/7. The Castle is still owned today by the Landale Family. It has recently been restored and is in a good state of repair.
